page.title: 08Dodman Point
page.content: The Dodman is owned by the National Trust.Iron Age ramparts still standing are covered in bracken,wild flowers, and a few stunted trees.The area is mostly pasture land,grazed by Friesian and Charollais heifers;two fields are cut for hay.There are many rabbits, foxes,badgers,and wild birds.On the 372ft. top of the Dodman stands a huge granite cross erected by Rev.George Martin,Rector of Caerhays,and inscribed "In the firm hope of the second coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and for the encouragement of those who strive to serve Him;this cross erected A.D.1896".Looking Westward one can see the Lizard and the Earth Satellite Station;to the East Looe Island and beyond to Rame Head;to the North St. Gorran Church tower,the China Clay spoil heaps,and Bodmin Moor.
